type.title: Type
type.description:
The body type: static, kinematic, or dynamic.
static: zero mass, zero velocity, may be manually moved
kinematic: zero mass, non-zero velocity set by user, moved by solver
dynamic: positive mass, non-zero velocity determined by forces, moved by solver
Note: if a dynamic body would have zero mass, the mass is set to one.

linear_velocity.title: Linear Velocity
linear_velocity.description: The linear velocity of the body's origin in world co-ordinates.

angular_velocity.title: Angular Velocity
angular_velocity.description: The angular velocity of the body.

linear_damping.title: Linear Damping
linear_damping.description:
Linear damping is use to reduce the linear velocity. The damping parameter can be larger than 1.0f but the damping effect becomes sensitive to the time step when the damping parameter is large.
Units are 1/time

angular_damping.title: Angular Damping
angular_damping.description:
Angular damping is use to reduce the angular velocity. The damping parameter can be larger than 1.0f but the damping effect becomes sensitive to the time step when the damping parameter is large.
Units are 1/time

allow_sleep.title: Allow Sleep
allow_sleep.description: Set this flag to false if this body should never fall asleep. Note that this increases CPU usage.

awake.title: Awake
awake.description: Is this body initially awake or sleeping?

fixed_rotation.title: Fixed Rotation
fixed_rotation.description: Should this body be prevented from rotating? Useful for characters.

bullet.title: Is Bullet
bullet.description:
Is this a fast moving body that should be prevented from tunneling through other moving bodies? Note that all bodies are prevented from tunneling through kinematic and static bodies. This setting is only considered on dynamic bodies.
WARNING You should use this flag sparingly since it increases processing time.

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: Does this body start out enabled?

gravity_scale.title: Gravity Scale
gravity_scale.description: Scale the gravity applied to this body.

friction.title: Friction
friction.description: The friction coefficient, usually in the range [0,1].

restitution.title: Restitution
restitution.description: The restitution (elasticity) usually in the range [0,1].

restitution_threshold.title: Restitution Threshold
restitution_threshold.description: Restitution velocity threshold, usually in m/s. Collisions above this speed have restitution applied (will bounce).

is_sensor.title: Is Sensor
is_sensor.description: A sensor shape collects contact information but never generates a collision response.
